bibl.title: Letter from Homer N. Calver to Henry Rose Carter, December 5, 1924

div1.p: Calver writes that the American Public Health Association has named Carter an Honorary Fellow. The enclosed autograph reply expresses thanks.

div1.head: Letter from Homer N. Calver to Henry Rose Carter, December 5, 1924
div1.opener:
Miscel
P. H. Assoc
THE AMERICAN PUBLIC HEALTH ASSOCIATION
Executive Office
370 Seventh Ave., New York City
December 5, 1924
Henry R. Carter, M. D.,
United States Public Health Service,
Washington, D.C.
My dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
It gives me great pleasure to advise you
that the Governing Council of the American
Public Health Association, in session during
the Fifty-Third Annual Meeting, held at
Detroit, Michigan, October 20-23, elected
you an Honorary Fellow of the Association.
This is the highest honor the Association
can confer upon a non-member.
div1.closer:
